examples: She went off on a tangent about what happened to her last summer.
He always goes off at a tangent when we talk about something serious.
Tangent is opposite over adjacent.
Tangent is opposite over adjacent.

words.defineEn: a straight line that touches a curve or surface at exactly one point, known as the point of tangency
words.defineVi: một đường thẳng chạm vào một đường cong hoặc bề mặt tại chính xác một điểm, được gọi là điểm tiếp tuyến

examples: So the force is all tangential to the direction of rotation.
So the force is all tangential to the direction of rotation.
The direction would also be tangential to the surface.
They're both tangential to the path, to our curve.
We call this tangential thinking when the trail off doesn't get back to the original point.
words.defineEn: not or barely relevant to something
words.defineVi: không hoặc hầu như không liên quan đến một cái gì đó

examples: Information is nothing tangible.

words.defineEn: perceptible by the senses especially the sense of touch

examples: When the teacher fell ill, the substitute had to step into the breach and take over the class.

By 1990, CPUs breached the 1 million transistor count.
words.defineEn: an act that violates an agreement, law, etc.
words.defineVi: một hành động vi phạm một thỏa thuận, pháp luật, vv

examples: Most babies are not breech at full term.

Goffman: "C-sections are always necessary for breech births."
Along with the tunic, the uniform includes trousers known as breeches, a Stetson hat, a Sam Browne belt, and a pair of high leather Strathcona boots.
words.defineEn: opening in the rear of the barrel of a gun where bullets can be loaded
words.defineVi: lỗ ở phía sau nòng súng nơi có thể nạp đạn

examples: If U.S. against Microsoft is giving credence above Novell against Microsoft, it has a lot to say on controlling the almost unaccountable power of the Big Tech firms.
We both agree that we have to get unaccountable money out of our political system and that we have to do much more to ensure that Wall Street never wrecks main street again.
words.defineEn: not to be accounted for or explained
words.defineVi: không được giải thích hoặc giải thích

examples: They had only to learn to ignore their passions and interests, and remain unaffected by deceivers throwing dust in their eyes.

In those postures, that's unaffected.
Since no mass is taken away or added to the Earth, our orbit is completely unaffected.

words.defineEn: undergoing no change when acted upon
words.defineVi: không thay đổi khi bị tác động

examples: So, to me, it's an unalloyed good.
So, to me, it's an unalloyed good.

words.defineEn: characteristic of or relating to winter
words.defineVi: đặc trưng của hoặc liên quan đến mùa đông

words.defineEn: charge falsely or with malicious intent; attack the good name and reputation of someone
words.defineVi: tính phí sai hoặc với mục đích xấu; tấn công tên tốt và danh tiếng của một ai đó

examples: The editor-in-chief instructed her reporters to uphold journalistic ethics and avoid using language that could be seen as defamatory or discriminatory, reminding them of the proverb a goose quill is more dangerous than a lion's claw.
In France, from the mid-16th century though the French revolution, circulating defamatory pamphlets could be punishable by death.
words.defineEn: (of statements) intending to ruin someone's reputation with the use of unpleasant or false information
words.defineVi: (của các tuyên bố) có ý định hủy hoại danh tiếng của ai đó bằng cách sử dụng thông tin khó chịu hoặc sai lệch

examples: We could be sued for slander or defamation.

words.defineEn: an abusive attack on a person's character or good name
words.defineVi: một cuộc tấn công lạm dụng vào nhân vật của một người hoặc tên tốt

examples: Was that a philosophy that there was more behind it, that this actually is a good way to either irk him or get him to move in some way?

words.defineEn: so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness
words.defineVi: quá thiếu quan tâm đến mức gây ra sự mệt mỏi về tinh thần

examples: The study analyzed the yield of various crops across different regions, providing valuable insights for agricultural planning.
The scientist abstracted the data from various sources to analyze trends.
The software engineers had to run the bug to ground by analyzing lines of code and testing various scenarios.
The detective knew that facts are stubborn things and that the evidence would lead to the truth, so he meticulously gathered and analyzed all the clues in the case.

words.defineEn: to examine or study something in detail in order to explain or understand it
words.defineVi: để kiểm tra hoặc nghiên cứu một cái gì đó một cách chi tiết để giải thích hoặc hiểu nó

examples: Analysts predict record growth of sales in 2021, especially in Europe and China.

words.defineVi: một cá nhân được đào tạo có liên quan đến việc phân tích các sự kiện và cung cấp cho người khác thông tin

examples: Have your pet spayed or neutered.

words.defineVi: để loại bỏ các cơ quan sinh dục của một con vật nuôi để giữ cho nó khỏi sinh sản

examples: So four of these carbons are neutral.
